question: Which Swedish pop group rose to international fame after winning Eurovision in 1974?
Which progressive rock band released the album ‘The Dark Side of the Moon’ in 1973?
Which singer, known as the ‘Queen of Disco,’ had hits like ‘Hot Stuff’ and ‘Bad Girls’ in the late 1970s?
Which American singer-songwriter released the hit 1971 album ‘Tapestry’?
Which iconic American singer died at the age of 42 at his Graceland estate in 1977?
Which Jamaican singer, regarded as a pioneer of reggae, gained global acclaim with ‘No Woman, No Cry’ in the 1970s?
Which British glam rock artist adopted the alter ego Ziggy Stardust in the early 1970s?
Stevie Nicks and Lindsey Buckingham joined which band in 1974, later releasing the album ‘Rumours’ in 1977?
Which German band is considered a pioneer of electronic music, releasing ‘Autobahn’ in 1974?
Which American singer was known for ‘Piano Man’ (1973) and ‘Just the Way You Are’ (1977)?
